author: Filip Timotija
description: Former Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haley condemned the Trump administration’s decision to take a 10 percent stake in Intel.  “Biden was wrong to subsidize the private sector with the Chips Act using our tax dollars. The counter to Biden is not to lean in and have govt own part of Intel,” Haley, who was the...
title: Haley condemns Trump admin’s Intel deal as ‘what not to do’

author: Angelique Brenes
description: "You have not been a model prisoner."
title: Lyle Menendez denied parole after brother’s denial the day before

author: Julia Mueller
description: California will ask voters this fall to decide whether to redraw this state’s congressional lines after its Democratic-controlled Legislature formally approved a sweeping redistricting plan on Thursday, a response to GOP-led efforts in Texas.  The plan, if voters give it the green light, could give Democrats five additional House seats, potentially nullifying the gains Republicans...
title: 5 things to know about California's special election on redistricting

author: Filip Timotija
description: Trade negotiations between the U.S. and India are ongoing, although New Delhi has some “red lines” that it will defend, according to India's foreign minister.  “I mean, negotiations are still going on in the sense that nobody said the negotiations are off. You know? I mean, and people, people do talk to each other,” Indian...
title: US, India trade negotiations ongoing, foreign minister says

author: John deVadoss, opinion contributor
description: The U.S. should establish a Public AI Wealth Fund to ensure that the public benefits from the returns of AI, while using competition, data, labor and energy rules to keep the field open and the harms in check.
title: Congress should create a public AI wealth fund

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump is seeing a growing disapproval rating among Americans seven months into his second White House term, according to a Friday survey. .  The Economist/YouGov poll found that 40 percent of Americans “strongly or somewhat” approve of Trump’s handling of the presidency. More than half of U.S. adults, 56 percent, said they “strongly or...
title: Trump sees growing disapproval rating among Americans, survey shows

author: Alix Martichoux
description: Dentists warn they're seeing cases of something nicknamed "Ozempic teeth."
title: Ozempic teeth: Dentists warn of new GLP-1 side effect

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: Miles Taylor, a former Department of Homeland Security (DHS) official, signaled Saturday that he could be the next target of President Trump's FBI after ex-national security adviser John Bolton's Washington-area home was raided by agents early Friday. Taylor, who served as a deputy chief of staff at DHS under Trump's first term, was asked by...
title: Former DHS official signals he could be next after Bolton FBI raid: ‘We expect it’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The federal government said it would deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda after he declined a plea deal, according to court filings. Federal prosecutors on Thursday offered Abrego Garcia the option to “live freely” with refugee or residency status in Costa Rica after serving prison time for federal human smuggling charges in exchange for a...
title: US seeks to deport Abrego Garcia to Uganda

author: José Alemán, opinion contributor
description: Panama has taken substantial steps to uphold international sanctions and maritime security, and has demonstrated its commitment to transparency and international cooperation by delisting vessels flagged for sanctionable activities and implementing a ban on registering oil tankers and bulk carriers older than 15 years.
title: Panama stands firm on Iranian, Russian sanctions and maritime security

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: President Trump on Saturday reupped his support for Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick (R), just hours after the state legislature advanced new congressional maps that could give the GOP up to five more seats in the House during next year's midterms. Trump lauded Patrick as a "terrific and powerful" lieutenant governor and "incredible friend" to...
title: Trump lauds Dan Patrick for Texas GOP's 'HUGE VICTORY' in redistricting battle

author: Mneesha Gellman, opinion contributor
description: In light of new information about its reporting on country conditions in El Salvador, I fear I can no longer rely on the State Department as a credible source.
title: The State Department is lying about El Salvador

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: “Perception” remains the coin of the realm in politics, and those with any real experience in the field know that it can be flipped in a second back against you, your candidate and your party.
title: A warning for Republicans overconfident about 2026 and 2028

author: Ella Lee
description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is not backing down.   Her sprawling business fraud case against President Trump took a meteoric hit when a divided appeals court Thursday threw out the roughly $500 million civil fraud penalty against him and his company despite keeping the case intact.  However, she vowed to appeal to the state’s...
title: Letitia James to advance fraud appeal as DOJ pressure campaign intensifies

author: Scott C. Mallett, opinion contributor
description: For decades, the Republican Party has marketed itself as the nation’s fiscal conscience when it comes to curbing spending and safeguarding future generations from crushing debt. The branding is so effective that many Democrats tacitly concede the point, while Republican voters cling to the belief their party holds the line on excess. A closer look reveals...
title: The petrodollar, not GOP fiscal restraint, is what sustains our unsustainable debt

author: Addy Bink
description: We already observed one of the holidays in May, so when is the other?
title: Trump established two new holidays: When is the next one?

author: Zach Kaplan
description: Tammi Menendez expressed frustration with Parole Commissioner Robert Barton, saying he had "his mind made up to deny Erik parole from the start!"
title: Erik Menendez's wife calls parole denial a 'complete setup'

author: Lisa H. Sideris, opinion contributor
description: Lee Zeldin’s dismissal of climate change as “religion” is a smear tactic as old as the environmental movement itself. It’s also an insult to religion and religious values.
title: Trump's bogus claim about a 'climate religion’ is a pathetic political dodge

author: Teddy Grant
description: Lorne Michaels, 80, confirmed that there will be a big cast shakeup for “SNL’s” 51st season.
title: ‘SNL’ cast shakeup coming in about a week:  Lorne Michaels

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Former FBI deputy director Andrew McCabe questioned the veracity of statements made by Ghislaine Maxwell during an interview with Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche after transcripts were released on Friday. “It‘s so suspicious. When you listen to the tapes, you get the sense that Ghislaine Maxwell went into that room knowing what information she had...
title: McCabe casts doubt on Maxwell interview with DOJ: 'It's so suspicious'

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker (D) on Friday pushed back on President Trump's threat to target Chicago next in the Trump administration’s crackdown on crime following a sweeping takeover in the nation’s capital.  "As Donald Trump attempts to create chaos that distracts from his problems, we’ll call it out for what it is," Pritzker wrote in...
title: Pritzker slams Trump's threat to target Chicago next: 'We don’t play those games'

author: A.P.D.G. Everett, opinion contributor
description: People like me, who served our country, who overcame obstacles, who want to give back, are now being told: “You’re too expensive.”
title: Trump’s student loan caps cut veterans off from the American dream

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A federal judge on Friday extended a preliminary injunction that blocks President Trump from withholding funds from more than 30 “sanctuary cities" over policies that restrict local police from participating in immigration enforcement. U.S. District Judge William Orrick in San Francisco, an appointee of former President Obama, wrote in his decision that the Trump administration...
title: Judge blocks Trump admin from slashing ‘sanctuary city’ funding

author: Knox Thames, opinion contributor
description: I recently attended a small Hill event on a beautiful day to remember a dark anniversary: Eleven years after the Islamic State began its genocide against Yezidis in Iraq, Yezidi speakers shared about their challenges and needs. Convened in a small room deep in the Capitol Visitors Center, Yezidis shared stories of courage and pain....
title: Remember Iraq's Yezidis

author: Jared Gans
description: The Texas state Senate early Saturday signed off on a new congressional map, sending the legislation to Gov. Greg Abbott (R) to sign into law ahead of the 2026 midterms. The vote passed the upper chamber in a 18-11 party-line vote as expected, with Democrats denouncing the effort as a power grab. It came after...
title: Texas Senate approves new map, sending it to Abbott's desk

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Oye Owolewa, the District of Columbia's shadow representative, will not seek reelection in 2026 after five years in office. “I’m incredibly proud of our work since assuming this office. Ever since you first elected me in 2020, I took it upon myself to raise the bar. Together, we did just that!” Owolewa, a Democrat, said...
title: DC's shadow representative not seeking reelection

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: The Trump administration on Friday issued an order stopping all activities of a wind energy project in Rhode Island that could have supplied electricity to 350,000 homes.  The Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) in a letter sent to Ørsted, the Danish company operating the project, said the stop work order seeks "to address concerns...
title: Trump administration halts offshore wind project in Rhode Island

author: Kellie Meyer
description: “We live in the most dangerous national security moment since World War II,” Sen. Wicker told NewsNation before his departure.
title: Republican senators depart for Taiwan, Indo-Pacific trip
